org.kuali.kfs.sys.document.web
Class AccountingLinesTag

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.TagSupport
      javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.BodyTagSupport
          org.kuali.kfs.sys.document.web.AccountingLinesTag
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.BodyTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.IterationTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.JspTag, javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.Tag
public class AccountingLinesTag
extends javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.BodyTagSupport

This tag...how to describe what it does? It takes these groups of accounting lines and, you know, it, um...it renders them.

See Also:
Serialized Form

protected  void enforceCellCount(int cellCount)
          Oh yeah, we're enforcing! Oh yes we are! We're going through all the accounting line groups and we're saying to them, Hey! Hey you group! Are you going to render the number of cells that we've decided to enforce? And if they're like: Oh, no, I don't have that many cells, then we'll reset that group to render that many of cells!

getEnforcedCellCount

protected int getEnforcedCellCount()
Determines the cell count we're going to enforce, which is the maximum width in cell of any child group

Returns:
the cell count we'll enforce

enforceCellCount

protected void enforceCellCount(int cellCount)
Oh yeah, we're enforcing! Oh yes we are! We're going through all the accounting line groups and we're saying to them, Hey! Hey you group! Are you going to render the number of cells that we've decided to enforce? And if they're like: Oh, no, I don't have that many cells, then we'll reset that group to render that many of cells!

Parameters:
cellCount - the number of cells to uphold

renderHeader

protected void renderHeader(int cellCount)
                     throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Renders the beginning of the accounting line table, including the tab-container div

Parameters:
cellCount - the number of cells this table is wide
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException - thrown if rendering fails
